abstract: General Electric plans to double its clean technology venture capital investments from $25 million this year to $50 million a year by 2008. G.E. plans to make investments across the clean-tech sector including solar, biofuels and batteries. In January, G.E. led a $40 million investment round in A123Systems, a company developing lithium ion batteries for plug-in hybrid vehicles.
lead_paragraph: General Electric plans to double its clean technology venture capital investments from $25 million this year to $50 million a year by 2008. G.E. plans to make investments across the clean-tech sector including solar, biofuels and batteries. In January, G.E. led a $40 million investment round in A123Systems, a company developing lithium ion batteries for plug-in hybrid vehicles.

headline.main: G.E. to Double Down on Clean Tech Investments
